page.title: 10Customs in Hoyland Common.
page.content:
The Hoyland Common area is much more varied in terms of the social class of its inhabitants than it once was.This is probably due to a combination of the growth of the area and the decline of coalmining as the principal industry.
Nevertheless some distinctive customs are maintained. Pigeon-fancying is popular but the keeping of dogs as pets,especially Jack Russells,is almost universal amoung the working class.At anytime,night or day,men can be seen,usually with walking sticks,exercising their dogs.
